vignette.name: Using Max with Other Applications
vignette.bodytext: The Max application has two virtual sources — two sets of inputs and outputs that let you send MIDI data to and from other programs that are running on your computer. MIDI Setup Window displays of these virtual sources.

The output devices “from Max 1” and “from Max 2” are virtual sources of MIDI for other programs. You can select them MIDI inputs in another application and your application will receive MIDI data from Max.

The input devices “to Max 1” and “to Max 2” are virtual destinations — sources of MIDI input to Max from other programs. In order to use them, you must select “to Max 1” or “to Max 2” as MIDI output devices in another application.

bluebox.header2: Sending MIDI data to Max from another application

ul.li: Choose MIDI Setup... from the Edit menu to show the MIDI Setup Window.
Verify that the input sources “to Max 1” and “to Max 2” are on (i.e. that the “on” checkboxes are checked).
Start the application you want to send MIDI data from.
In the other application, set the MIDI output source to either “to Max 1” or “to Max 2.”

bluebox.header2: Sending MIDI data from Max to another application

ul.li: Choose MIDI Setup... from the Edit menu to show the MIDI Setup Window.
Verify that the output sources “from Max 1” and “from Max 2” are on (i.e. that the “on” checkboxes are checked).
Start the application you want to send MIDI data to.
In the other application, set the MIDI input source to either “from Max 1” or “from Max 2.”

vignette.bodytext: By default, Max creates two “virtual” MIDI ports for both input and output. To create additional virtual ports to your MIDI system in addition to to/from Max 1 and to/from Max 2, you will need to send messages to the Max application. At the present time, CoreMIDI is the only driver which supports the creation of virtual MIDI ports.

ul.li: Double-click anywhere in an unlocked Patcher window to show the Object Explorer
Click on the message box icon. The Object Explorer will disappear and a message box will appear with an active text cursor.

Note that the message starts with a semicolon.
